result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:16 AM Defendant Andre J Lowe in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Andre J Lowe.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. The State would like to address Count 3 as it was previously dismissed and would ask for the Court to reinstate those penalties. The State would further ask to file an information to include all three charges. No objection by Attorney Sonderhouse. The Court will grant the State's request and will reinstate Count 3. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated October 14 - defendant is requesting a copy of his discovery.
Atty. Ronald Sonderhouse
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:14 PM Defendant Andre J Lowe in court, in custody. Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Andre J Lowe. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Gutierrez states they need to appoint counsel outside their office and the defendant is willing to waive the time limits for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Court sets status of counsel date the day before preliminary hearing to ensure counsel was appointed which may be removed if an order appointing counsel is filed.  Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within .5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:14 PM Defendant Andre J Lowe in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
The Court does not find probable cause in Count 3.
The Court dismisses Count 3 on its own motion. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
